_header: Wherefore should I hang up my bow
Note:
For a companion piece, see 2176. See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1929.
_description: A ‘jolly forester:’ the lover still active — 4 stanzas in long-line couplets and 6-line burden: ‘I am a joly foster / I am a joly foster / And haue ben many a day / & foster will I be styll / For shote ryght well I may / For shot ryght well I may.’ Includes musical notation.

BLAdd31922.First Lines:
Wherfor shuld I hang vp my bow vpon the grenwod boughI cane bend
                    & draw a bow and shot well enough…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines:
…Wherfor shuld I tye vp my hownd vnto the grenwod sprayI can
                    luge and make a sute as well as any in may
